Solve the following system of linear equations using substitution method:

3x + 2y = 14

5x - y = 7
message_2:
First, we will solve one of the equations for one variable. Let's solve the second equation for y:

5x - y = 7
y = 5x - 7

Now, we will substitute this expression for y into the first equation:

3x + 2(5x - 7) = 14

Now, we will solve for x:

3x + 10x - 14 = 14
13x = 28
x = 28/13

Now that we have the value of x, we can substitute it back into the expression for y:

y = 5(28/13) - 7
y = 140/13 - 91/13
y = 49/13

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is:

x = 28/13
y = 49/13
